org.jorlib.frameworks.columnGeneration.colgenMain

Class ColGen<T extends ModelInterface,U extends AbstractColumn<T,V>,V extends AbstractPricingProblem<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jorlib.frameworks.columnGeneration.colgenMain.ColGen<T,U,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The data model
    U - Type of column
    V - Type of pricing problem

    public class ColGen<T extends ModelInterface,U extends AbstractColumn<T,V>,V extends AbstractPricingProblem<T>>
extends Object
    Main class defining the Column Generation procedure. It keeps track of all the data structures. Its solve() method is the core of this class. Assumptions: the Master problem is a minimization problem. The optimal solution with non-fractional variable values has an integer objective value.
    Version:
    13-4-2015
    Author:
    Joris Kinable

      • pricingProblemManager

        protected final PricingProblemManager<T extends ModelInterface,U extends AbstractColumn<T,V>,V extends AbstractPricingProblem<T>> pricingProblemManager
        Manages parallel execution of pricing problems

      • objective

        protected double objective
        Objective value of column generation procedure

      • upperBound

        protected int upperBound
        The Colgen procedure is terminated if objective exceeds upperBound. The Upperbound is set equal to the best incumbent integer solution

      • lowerBound

        protected double lowerBound
        Lower bound on the objective value. If lowerbound > upperBound, this node can be pruned.

      • nrOfColGenIterations

        protected int nrOfColGenIterations
        Total number of column generation iterations.

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public void solve(long timeLimit)
           throws TimeLimitExceededException
        Solve the Column Generation problem
        Parameters:
        timeLimit - Future point in time (ms) by which the procedure should be finished. Should be defined as: System.currentTimeMilis()+
        Throws:
        TimeLimitExceededException - Exception is thrown when time limit is exceeded

      • calculateLowerBound

        protected double calculateLowerBound(int solverID)
        Compute lower bound on the optimal objective value attainable by the the current master problem. The bound is based on both dual variables from the master, as well as the optimal pricing problem solutions. The parameter specifies which solver was last invoked to solve the pricing problems. Returns the best lower bound for the current master. NOTE: This method is not implemented by default.
        Parameters:
        solverID - id of last invoked solver: solvers.get(solverID)

      • getObjective

        public double getObjective()
        Returns:
        Returns the objective value of the column generation procedure

      • getLowerBound

        public double getLowerBound()
        Returns a lower bound on the objective of the column generation procedure. When the column generation procedure is solved to optimality, getObjective() and getLowerBound() should return the same value. However, if the column generation procedure terminates for example due to a time limit exceeded exception, there may be a gap in between those values.
        Returns:
        Returns a lower bound on the column generation objective

      • getNumberOfIterations

        public int getNumberOfIterations()
        Returns:
        Returns the number of column generation iterations performed

      • getRuntime

        public long getRuntime()
        Returns the total runtime
        Returns:
        Returns how much time it took to solve the column generation problem. This time equals: getMasterSolveTime()+getPricingSolveTime()+(small amount of overhead).

      • getMasterSolveTime

        public long getMasterSolveTime()
        Returns:
        Returns how much time was spent on solving the master problem

      • getPricingSolveTime

        public long getPricingSolveTime()
        Returns:
        Returns how much time was spent on solving the pricing problems

      • getNrGeneratedColumns

        public int getNrGeneratedColumns()
        Returns:
        Returns how many columns have been generated in total

      • getSolution

        public List<U> getSolution()
        Returns:
        Returns the solution maintained by the master problem

      • getCuts

        public List<Inequality> getCuts()
        Returns:
        Returns all cuts generated for the master problem

      • close

        public void close()
        Destroy both the master problem and pricing problems
